programme.title: WTA Final: Iasi 2024
programme.desc: 17-year-old Mirra Andreeva meets Elina Avanesyan in the Iasi final, with both players competing to become a first-time WTA title winner. (26.07)

programme.desc: A look at some of the best contests at The Open in years gone by. Here, a look at The 1985 Open at Royal St George's Golf Club, where a surprise winner would upset a prestigious field.

programme.desc: A look back at some of the best contests at The Open in years gone by. Here, The 1989 Open at Royal Troon Golf Club, where an American golfer would seize his first - and only - Major.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa's playgroup are making masks. There are carrot masks, robot masks, and even pretty butterfly masks... The only thing missing is lots and lots of glitter!

programme.title: The Stranger on the Shore

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James whips up a bread and butter pudding while chatting to a Hampshire-based dairy farmer, Paul Rankin cooks for James and fellow chef Lesley Waters. The host gives a masterclass in salt-baking fish, before he and Niall Keating treat TV presenter Scarlette Douglas to a chocolate fondant

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Sisters Sutandra and Sagarika from London, keen quizzers David and Tommy, a father and son from Carrickfergus in Northern Ireland, and Shropshire couple Joe and Kelly use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Carolen from Brixham, Angus from Keighley, Leah from Essex and Adam originally from Ealing pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Sarah thinks all hope is lost, Charity makes an offer, and John feels terrible about the week ahead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual Scarecrow Festival takes a grisly turn as bodies begin appearing on poles displayed alongside their straw creations. Barnaby and Winter's investigation reveals rivalries that run deep and shows people will do just about anything to win. Neil Dudgeon stars

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight: Should We Trash Cash?
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Sycamore Gap: Britain's Lost Landmark
programme.desc: In the early hours of the morning of September 28, 2023, two best friends took a chainsaw to a remote spot in Northumberland and chopped down one of the nation's best-known and best-loved trees. Extraordinarily, they filmed themselves committing a crime that shocked the world. As Daniel Graham and Adam Carruthers are sentenced for the felling of the Sycamore Gap tree, Tom Barton tells the full story of what happened that night. He hears from people whose biggest life events involved the tree, those who were responsible for caring for it, and the police officer who cracked the case

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Sarah Mack and Angus Simpson look at the stories of the Paisley man who invented the ATM, wrestler George Kidd, the world's first female commercial airline pilot Winnie Drinkwater, and author James Hogg

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Gary Imlach presents a look back at the 10 stages of the prestigious race, as the riders enjoy the first rest day. With reports by Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Sarah was left in the stairwell of a Surrey car park in 2001. She is the youngest foundling to appear on the show. Also looking for answers is Chris who, at three months old, was dropped off at a childminder's near Kings Cross in London, 62 years ago. He still needs to know who his birth family is and why nobody ever returned to pick him up. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell host

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities Rickie Williams, Melvin Odoom and Laura Crane, and those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Sycamore Gap: Britain's Lost Landmark
programme.desc: In the early hours of the morning of September 28, 2023, two best friends took a chainsaw to a remote spot in Northumberland and chopped down one of the nation's best-known and best-loved trees. Extraordinarily, they filmed themselves committing a crime that shocked the world. As Daniel Graham and Adam Carruthers are sentenced for the felling of the Sycamore Gap tree, Tom Barton tells the full story of what happened that night. He hears from people whose biggest life events involved the tree, those who were responsible for caring for it, and the police officer who cracked the case
